com.qtplaf.library.swing.core

Class SwingUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.swing.core.SwingUtils

  • public class SwingUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Swing utilities. Since javax.swing.SwingUtilities has a private constructor and can not be extended, what would be the natural way of adding functionality, the used methods of the swing class will be gradually delegated, to avoid having the utility functionality distributed over several classes.

    Simple methods like invokeLater will be simply copied, others more complicated will be delegated.

    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SwingUtils.AcceleratorKeyListener
      A key listener to manage accelerator keys.

      • factorScreenDimension

        public static java.awt.Dimension factorScreenDimension(java.awt.Window window,
                                                       double widthFactor,
                                                       double heightFactor)
        Gets a dimension applying a width and/or height factor relative to the screen dimension.
        Parameters:
        window - The window.
        widthFactor - The width factor relative to the screen (0 < factor <= 1).
        heightFactor - The height factor relative to the screen (0 < factor <= 1).
        Returns:
        The screen dimension.

      • moveWindowOnScreen

        public static java.awt.Point moveWindowOnScreen(java.awt.Window window,
                                                double factorWidth,
                                                double factorHeight)
        Locates a dimension on the screen being the left space the width factor of difference between the screen size and the dimension. A value of 0 moves the dimension to the left, while a value of 1 moves the dimension to the right. The same applies to the height.
        Parameters:
        window - The window.
        factorWidth - Width factor.
        factorHeight - Height factor.
        Returns:
        The top-left corner point.
